intro: Tetrapterys seemannii, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, flat, woody pods that contain several seeds. Due to its hard, durable wood, it has been historically valued for its use in furniture and musical instruments.
